document: Chapter 05 - Working with Windows and CLI Systems.ppt

questions.question: What is the purpose of a file system?
options: To encrypt data on a disk
To give the OS a road map to data on a disk
questions.answer: To give the OS a road map to data on a disk

questions.question: What information does CMOS store?
options: System configuration and date and time information
questions.answer: System configuration and date and time information

questions.question: What does BIOS contain?
options: Programs that perform input and output at the hardware level
questions.answer: Programs that perform input and output at the hardware level

questions.question: What is the bootstrap process?
options: The process contained in ROM that tells the computer how to proceed during startup
The process of defragmenting a hard drive
The process of backing up data
questions.answer: The process contained in ROM that tells the computer how to proceed during startup

questions.question: What is wear-leveling in solid-state storage devices?
options: A feature that slows down the device over time
An internal firmware feature that ensures even wear of read/writes for all memory cells
A way to increase storage capacity
questions.answer: An internal firmware feature that ensures even wear of read/writes for all memory cells

questions.question: What are clusters in Microsoft file structures?
options: Storage allocation units of one or more sectors
questions.answer: Storage allocation units of one or more sectors

questions.question: What is the Master Boot Record (MBR)?
options: A backup of the operating system
A critical data structure on the first sector containing partition information
A log of all deleted files
questions.answer: A critical data structure on the first sector containing partition information

questions.question: What replaces the Master Boot Record in modern systems?
questions.answer: GUID Partition Table (GPT)

questions.question: What is drive slack?
options: The space used by the operating system
Unused space in a cluster between the end of an active file and the end of the cluster
Extra space added during disk formatting
questions.answer: Unused space in a cluster between the end of an active file and the end of the cluster

questions.question: What happens when a file is deleted in a FAT system?
options: It is immediately overwritten with zeros
The directory entry is marked with HEX E5 and FAT chain is set to 0
It is moved to a hidden system folder
questions.answer: The directory entry is marked with HEX E5 and FAT chain is set to 0

questions.question: What is the primary file system for Windows 8?
questions.answer: NTFS

questions.question: What contains information about all files on an NTFS disk?
questions.answer: Master File Table (MFT)

questions.question: How large is each record in the NTFS MFT?
questions.answer: 1024 bytes

questions.question: What are data runs in NTFS?
options: Programs that automatically back up data
Cluster addresses where nonresident files are stored
questions.answer: Cluster addresses where nonresident files are stored

questions.question: What are alternate data streams in NTFS?
options: Ways data can be appended to existing files as additional attributes
questions.answer: Ways data can be appended to existing files as additional attributes

questions.question: What does EFS stand for?
questions.answer: Encrypting File System

questions.question: How does EFS encrypt files?
options: Using public key and private key methods
questions.answer: Using public key and private key methods

questions.question: What is the Windows Registry?
options: A program for editing text files
A database storing hardware/software configuration and user preferences
A backup utility for system files
questions.answer: A database storing hardware/software configuration and user preferences

questions.question: What can be used to view the Windows Registry?
questions.answer: Registry Editor (Regedit or Regedt32)

questions.question: What is a virtual machine?
options: A physical computer with multiple operating systems
A representation of another computer on an existing physical computer
A type of external hard drive
questions.answer: A representation of another computer on an existing physical computer

questions.question: What is one benefit of virtual machines in digital forensics?
options: They allow restoring suspect drives and running nonstandard software
questions.answer: They allow restoring suspect drives and running nonstandard software

questions.question: What does whole disk encryption help prevent?
options: Loss of personal identity information and trade secrets from computer theft
questions.answer: Loss of personal identity information and trade secrets from computer theft

questions.question: What feature is common in whole disk encryption tools?
questions.answer: Preboot authentication

questions.question: What does BitLocker require for hardware?
options: A specific brand of hard drive
TPM (Trusted Platform Module) microchip version 1.2 or newer
questions.answer: TPM (Trusted Platform Module) microchip version 1.2 or newer

questions.question: What does LCN stand for in NTFS?
questions.answer: Logical Cluster Number
